alert.note: Alert for Crowley; Pueblo (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 24 at 5:28PM MDT until May 24 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MDT FOR WEST CENTRAL CROWLEY AND NORTHEASTERN PUEBLO COUNTIES... At 528 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 9 miles northwest of Olney Springs, or 31 miles east of Pueblo, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Crowley and northeastern Pueblo Counties. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
